titleStmt.title: [Drawing depicting a late 18th century Cherokee domestic structure] / [by Thomas Whyte] : a machine-readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Whyte, ThomasR.

availability.p: This work is the property of the McClung Museum, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text.

bibl.title: [Drawing depicting a late 18th century Cherokee domestic structure] / [by Thomas Whyte]
bibl.author: Whyte, Thomas R.
bibl.note: This is a drawing of a late 18th century Cherokee domestic structure, based on historic descriptions and archaeological excavations by the University of Tennessee. This rectangular building is typical of a Cherokee summer home, which was usually built next to a conical winter house. Excavations were conducted under contract with the National Park Service and the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) in anticipation of the flooding of the Lower Little Tennessee River by the Tellico Dam Reservoir. The drawing is by Thomas Whyte.
Frank H. McClung Museum Photographic Collection

projectDesc.p: Prepared for The University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with Microsoft Word spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points

figure.figDesc: Artist drawing of late 18th century Cherokee domestic structure, based on historic descriptions and archaeological excavations by the University of Tennessee. Drawing by Thomas Whyte. This information was provided by the Frank H. McClung Museum.

p.note: This document consists of one image only.
